programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Almost the Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: Dave puts a bid in for a unit of motor parts, much to the surprise of the buyers, who thought he was broke.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team are all about cutting deals, but it remains to be seen what happens when Chum takes a stab at three Japanese Samurai swords.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 18th-century Tryal of Witches book is brought to the shop, as well as a gold-plated banjo, and the guys check out the restored car from Wayne's World.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After Seth rescinds his invasive search policies for his employees, the women to return to work. The leader soon wrestles with a new problem - profits are down, so he looks at creative ways to get new customers into the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The staff receive complaints from customers that a staff member has been letting customers cut in line in exchange for a tip. They later find out that Anton, who works the pawn desk, is responsible.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The guys restore a miniature car they found in a junkyard, while a fireman brings in a vintage 1930s forest field service phone.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A customer pays the team $10,000 to restore a 1950s soda fountain - and expects to get his money's worth. The guys also try to restore a vintage phone box.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: Examining the death of 76-year-old Patricia Goodband, who vanished over the Christmas period in 2012, before her body was discovered weeks later in the grounds of her home. The programme reveals how the murderer tried to throw police off their scent, but was ultimately undone by a piece of written evidence.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Challenging investigations in modern law enforcement, profiling completed cases that were far from straightforward.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The big money buyers find themselves out of their comfort zones in DeSoto, and a new face from across the pond threatens to ruin Ricky and Bubba's day.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas hoping to land a locker of a lifetime, and Mary flouts the law in her eagerness to score a dream unit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth swaps the workstations for two members of his team. However, Les becomes angered at the situation, feeling that the arrangement was good enough in the first place.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Jeff calls in sick, leading to Seth to order everyone to stay away from his desk in any circumstances. He then finds Bobby J in the banned area, polishing a ring for a customer.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Superman v Muhammad Ali comic book is brought into the shop, and Rick attempts to figure out why all the office phones are broken.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1951 Willys Wagon gathers interest when it pulls into the shop. Rick is also intrigued by a pair of 19th-century European swords.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts investigate the mystery of the Solway Firth Spaceman - a spacesuit-cladded figure who appeared in a photograph taken in Cumbria.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise the Maya calendar, which predicted the world would end in 2012, and try to determine whether it could have anticipated the arrival of an extraterrestrial god.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is asked to make a barber's chair look like a sports car, while Tyler and Ron deal with a disagreement by playing pranks on each other.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Chumlee gives the team an unusual challenge involving a pedal car. The crew also works on a 1960s motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a warm-up jersey signed by Kobe Bryant. Then, he has an axe to grind over a seller's asking price for an antique weapon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines a 1973 Marshall Amp, and a hover-board from the movie Back to the Future Part II, signed by the cast.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod take an interest in a furniture locker in Upland, California. Dave bids for a locker full of jewellery, but it remains to be seen if the contents are real.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds what could be a valuable antique gun - or possibly a worthless fake. Jarrod and Brandi get their hands on a collection of Depression-era art.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Competitors march into a dry moat where they resurrect old swords and forge them into a Viking Seax, using the time-tested coal forge. The finalists return home to recreate a pair of deadly Viking War axes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed first edition of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz is brought into the shop and Corey races to check out a one-of-a-kind Turbo Drive II arcade game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick takes a look at some original blueprints to the Hoover Dam, and Chumlee has a potentially costly accident.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the complex relationship between presidents and aliens, contemplating how much such powerful men know about extra-terrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate mysterious beings with big heads and eyes, whose images were found carved into rocks. Known as the 'greys', they are rumoured to be alien life forms.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les sells a valuable Breitling watch for $42,000 to a trusted watch collector that he dealt with many times before. His customer does not have the funds, so Les gives him the merchandise in exchange for an IOU. Seth has grave misgivings about the deal, but Les still has trust in the customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a deal to get the others off his back, but when some interesting animals come through the door, it might be too much for him to resist.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave wins a furniture unit, Darrell gets hold of some 1970s sound equipment, and Barry lays his hands on something truly vintage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The guys bid for crates at a vault sale and Darrell prepares for a showdown with Dave.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Potential money-spinners include gold and silver coins, tax stamps, an album signed by Bob Marley, and a vintage Win-a-Card game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts assess an ancient coin, and an autographed movie poster for the movie Reservoir Dogs.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Haunted Antique Store and More
programme.desc: The stories of a UFO spotted over Inner Mongolia, a poltergeist haunting a British antique shop and a father and son who claimed to have encountered Bigfoot in Washington.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts try to solve paranormal phenomena, looking at the Bermuda Triangle in the hope they can determine what has caused ships and planes to disappear.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod take an interest in a furniture locker in Upland, California. Dave bids for a locker full of jewellery, but it remains to be seen if the contents are real.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds what could be a valuable antique gun - or possibly a worthless fake. Jarrod and Brandi get their hands on a collection of Depression-era art.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Maisie Adam, Sara Barron and Rob Beckett are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Canadian comedienne Katherine Ryan, Radio 4 favourite Milton Jones and Stand Up for the Week's Josh Widdicombe join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison to offer a satirical take on current events. From 2012.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2004, with Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Mark Steel and Phill Jupitus facing the questions. As ever, host Stephen Fry will only award points for answers he finds interesting.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress and presenter Mel Giedroyc, heavyweight boxer David Haye, actor-musician Martin Kemp and comedian Romesh Ranganathan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed host Rob Brydon's liar of the week.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: It a proud day for Josh's football team - Plymouth Argyle - as they have reached the Football League Trophy Area Final Southern Section. Unfortunately, Owen's cousin has moved in on probation and is hogging the television with his N64 video game console. Meanwhile, Kate helps her mother dump her new boyfriend. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, Jack Dee and Beattie Edmondson.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, journalist and newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedian Jack Whitehall, newsreader Emily Maitlis, actor Jim Carter and writer, producer and director Armando Iannucci to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: CS gas is used to stop a crazed axeman, a drunk student cannot understand why he's being arrested and a joker insults a cop but uses his charm to avoid arrest.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a 135-year-old opera house full of memorabilia, and try to negotiate with a fellow picker charging a high price for his merchandise.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The chance of winning a car at a blind auction in Perth sends the gang into a bidding frenzy. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Blackpool Pleasure Beach, where Nat and John gamble on a mode of transport, and an unpopular bargain hunter returns to the group.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a collection of classic cars in Colorado, including a 1961 Messerschmitt, and decide to make an offer on a prize exhibit.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. The guys unearth ultra-rare skis for a Model T Ford as they pick one of the biggest barns they've ever seen.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John and Dave get rid of unwanted skips and trailers, which are home to some unusual objects. Elsewhere, emergency repairs are required to get two police bikes back out on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc and Chris Harris review the new Bentley Continental GT, while Chris also attempts to tame the scariest Porsche 911 of all time. Rory Reid test drives the new Renault Megane hot hatch, and Gregory Porter joins the team in the studio.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A 999 call from a teenager sparks a race against time for Nadiene and volunteer Matt. When confronted with an aggressive man, the pair are forced to hit their emergency buttons.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc, Chris Harris and Rory Reid buy three used luxury limousines from Rolls-Royce, Bentley and Mercedes for the price of the cheapest new car in Britain. The glamorous cars are then put through their paces in a gruelling six-hour endurance challenge at Silverstone. Plus, Countryfile's Matt Baker drops in to the studio.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc test drives the new Aston Martin V8 Vantage, while Rory Reid puts the Rolls-Royce Phantom through its paces to see if it lives up to its reputation as the best car in the world, and Chris Harris makes the case that a Ford Fiesta is better than a Lamborghini. With guest Stephen Mangan.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Regular panellist Alan Davies joined by comedy actor Chris Addison, broadcaster Sara Cox and Bake Off co-presenter Sue Perkins. In his last regular edition as host, Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he considers most interesting regardless of whether or not they are correct. Sandi Toksvig picks up Fry's baton from the 'n' series, but before then Fry will host two shows featuring his favourite moments.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Shappi Khorsandi, Michael Buerk, Amanda Abbington and Elis James test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Dee, Seann Walsh and Milton Jones
programme.desc: Jack Dee hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by observational comedian Seann Walsh and king of the one-liners Milton Jones.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade, Sindhu Vee, Ed Gamble and Chloe Petts are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2004, with Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Mark Steel and Phill Jupitus facing the questions. As ever, host Stephen Fry will only award points for answers he finds interesting.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The incredible efforts to ensure that the hastily constructed temporary fix around the damaged reactor at Chernobyl becomes a permanent solution, known as the New Safe Confinement.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Nazi Wives
programme.desc: Documentary about the most important women in Hitler's life, and the role women played in the Nazi regime.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How a team of intrepid engineers keep the London Array, one of the largest offshore wind farms on the planet, maintained and producing electricity whatever the weather.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Portugal to meet leading experts on the Three Secrets of Fatima - a series of visions and prophecies allegedly given by the Virgin Mary to three young shepherds in 1917.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Staff have to deal with more than 100,000 festival-goers travelling to Glastonbury by rail from around Britain and the royal train stops at St Erth station in Cornwall, before the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh board a scheduled service to St Ives. There is drama at Castle Cary when a passenger falls on to the tracks and police and workers struggle to pull him to safety.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How the SAS War Crimes Investigation Team tried to pinpoint the location of Gestapo officers who were wanted for a host of atrocities.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Maritime engineering in recent years has seen ever bigger ships and sea-based platforms constructed. On occasion, they may need moving, which is the purpose of the Boka Vanguard, the planet's largest heavy lift ship, capable of sinking itself, floating under its cargo and then lifting it up to be moved anywhere on the planet with sea. This extraordinary work of engineering is capable of carrying the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty at the same time.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: The work carried out by ONE Columba, which is capable of carrying 14,000 shipping containers, but has the dangerous challenge of navigating twisting rivers and ancient ports.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the gritty Glasgow-based detective drama. Three teachers at an exclusive boys' boarding school are murdered in bizarre circumstances - could there be a connection to the macabre discovery of a skeleton buried in the grounds? Starring James Macpherson, Blythe Duff and Colin McCredie.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: A faith healer divides the Thrift into believers and non-believers, and Dr Marsham is particularly upset by his interference.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha begins to feel she's trapped in a never-ending nightmare when a confrontation with Abi leads to yet another revelation - she intends to marry her erstwhile kidnapper Hugh. Turning to Phil for help, Samantha hatches a plan to snatch her pregnant, brainwashed daughter from the psychopath's clutches - but it seems she may have underestimated the extent of his cunning. Community Support Officers Laura Bryant and Colin Fairfax are assigned to Sun Hill, where they are greeted by a contemptuous outburst from Dale, and Honey oversteps the line when she attempts to console a distraught husband whose wife has gone missing.

programme.title: Garden Rivals
programme.desc: Ann-Marie Powell offers a serene garden and Chris Collins puts forward a design of interlocking circles. Presented by 'Handy' Andy Kane.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Robert serves on the Re-Vaccination Committee. When Emmaline comes to the Bramwells' house for help, they suspect she may suffer a reaction to Finn's vaccination experiments.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark gets the thumbs-up in his psychiatric report and rejoins the Fusiliers, determined to make a fresh start. Unfortunately, CSM Fitzpatrick isn't convinced he is up to the job and resolves to make life difficult for him, with disastrous consequences for Tony and Jacko.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha begins to feel she's trapped in a never-ending nightmare when a confrontation with Abi leads to yet another revelation - she intends to marry her erstwhile kidnapper Hugh. Turning to Phil for help, Samantha hatches a plan to snatch her pregnant, brainwashed daughter from the psychopath's clutches - but it seems she may have underestimated the extent of his cunning. Community Support Officers Laura Bryant and Colin Fairfax are assigned to Sun Hill, where they are greeted by a contemptuous outburst from Dale, and Honey oversteps the line when she attempts to console a distraught husband whose wife has gone missing.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sean realises Jess doesn't love him and ends their relationship, while Connie takes advantage of both her husband's new-found power and the conflict between Zubin and Ric to expand her influence. Chrissie arranges for Mark to be interviewed for a permanent position, which he decides to take to prove to Tricia he can be counted on. Dominic Fryer returns to Holby and is attacked by a student, leaving him in need of urgent attention. Diane later finds the girl in question has taken an overdose, and suspects he has raped her as well. She makes her accusation public while he is in surgery, just as the procedure goes badly wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: It's the new senior staff nurse's first day. Meanwhile, George gets involved in the relationship of two brothers, and a woman suffers a miscarriage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hugh Wallis turns the tables on Sam Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, Sam desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and Jack Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered and Honey Harmon oversteps the bounds of duty when she attempts to comfort the grieving widower. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Georgia Moffett.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tricky Dicky helps Rachel acquire new stock, but Kathy suspects his motives. And things go from bad to worse between Grant and Sharon.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon feels vulnerable and confused by the way Grant has behaved recently. His loyal brother Phil faces a struggle with his conscience.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team are called to a horrific fire in a music recording studio. Elsewhere, Sicknote wins the council election. Starring Sean Blowers and Richard Walsh.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A firearms expert agrees to repair a valuable antique gun on Lovejoy's behalf, but unfortunately for all concerned, it is later used in a robbery. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim's relationship with Susan deteriorates further, and he throws himself into his work, hunting down a friend of Charlie who has been accused of insider trading. Ronald Pickup guest stars, with John Nettles and Louise Jameson.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: It's the big day for Billy and Julie at the Registrar's office and for Freddie at the Court House. Cousin Eddie arrives from Canada.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Constant rain puts a damper on the holidaymakers' fun, and it isn't long before the Yellowcoats are scraping the bottom of the barrel in a bid to devise new indoor amusements to keep the guests occupied. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell and Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is surprised to receive a letter from ex-wife Margaret and arranges an informal get-together to chat about old times. However, it soon transpires that her glamorous lifestyle isn't all it seems. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Caroline Blakistone.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Road Rage
programme.desc: Howard gets a bargain when he buys a used car, but the attention he gets from a burly local is more than he bargained for. Long-running comedy, starring Robert Fyfe and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: When her niece's son is charged with possession of an ecstasy tablet, suspicions remain that he has been framed, so Hetty goes undercover in his school as a cafeteria worker to clear his name. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of two. Peregrine convinces Eric to come clean about a past crime that will clear his name for the murders, and Violetta's hidden musical talents put her and Peregrine in grave danger. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.sub-title: Eyes Down for a Full House
programme.desc: Standing loses 10,000 in a high-stakes poker game - but his opponent, a bookmaker, agrees to write off the debt if the detective can bring his father's killer to justice. Lane helps him uncover a connection with the case of a champion greyhound abducted in the 1980s, and a map comes to light that appears to lead to the missing dog's grave. Meanwhile, a widow mounts a protest outside the station.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The murder of two Glasgow women prompts the detectives to investigate an apparently respectable escort agency. Meanwhile, a man from the Highlands reports his wife missing. James Macpherson stars.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: With the testimony of a vital witness confirming some of Stan and Mick's suspicions, Taff still remains unconvinced, but the police are now forced to question what they thought they knew previously, and pursue the case against Jeremy. Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. Starring Mark Addy, Alexa Davies, Freddie Fox and Tom Christian.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to Lyon, where the famous food market provides plenty of inspiration for a Lyonnaise bacon salad, before he visits one of the city's many Michelin-starred restaurants to experience some fine dining. In his own kitchen, James shows how to make one of France's best-known desserts - creme brulee.

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five golfing friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Sally, Scott, Vikki and Andrew pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Labour Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona blurts out a theory while visiting Marlon, Vanessa feels trapped by Charity's lie, and Matty finds himself in danger at the farm.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ray tries to convince Alya that he did not have designs on her, and David is devastated when the doctor reveals Shona does not want to see him. When Alina reveals that she's looking for somewhere to live, Seb suggests to Emma that she could move in with them.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: On the final leg of their journey, the pair continue through the snow to New Hampshire. Here, they meet rally-driving champion Tim O'Neil who gives them a crash course in driving in the ice and snow before they take on an intense time trial. The pair travel on to Maine, where they take part in some wilderness training, before bidding farewell to the RV and heading out into the extremely choppy seas for some lobster fishing. Before heading home, the pair look back on some of their favourite moments from the trip.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Abi is shocked to hear the allegations about Ray, while Maria hands David her keys, telling him she would like him to have her car. Ryan hands Gary an envelope full of cash and confirms it's the last of his debt collections.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: The evidence is examined as Jeremy's trial begins, with dramatic and conflicting witness testimony being given before the jury and the packed public gallery, and the jury give their verdict on what really happened that fateful night at White House Farm. Starring Freddie Fox, Alfie Allen and Stephen Graham.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the that wakes up Italy is roasted. Plus, the manufacture of the bricks that built America, the oil that fills lava lamps, and how diamonds are blasted from a frozen volcano.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants to splash the cash on a custom bus, but mechanic Edd China favours a more conservative campervan due to him being an air-cooling expert. the two settle for a VW Split-Screen.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini searches for more high-end resoration projects, and uncovers numerous Mopar cars, a 1905 Cadillac and a Ferrari 330

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini gets a lead on a cache of three 308 Ferraris. Then, while Roger works on a belt job, Wayne puts on his sales hat to drum up clients for two more Ferraris - a 275 and a 430

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Paul Teutul Sr visits Europe, where he is inspired to collect vintage two-wheelers. Meanwhile, back at base the staff run into some problems.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Mike scours the country for a restoration shop for his prized Mach 1 and Richard brings the first his and hers' restoration, but the challenges of the two cars are not equal.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe assists the US Coastguard to recover and clean large, barnacle-covered buoys off the coast of San Francisco.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Action from Round Two at Motorpoint Arena, Cardiff.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how George Washington's favourite tipple is made, how aircraft seats are tested without crashing a plane, and the manufacturing processes behind billions of batteries.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are excited to receive an invite to meet a former racer and adrenaline junkie in his vintage Ohio garage.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to the West Midlands and London, where finds include a potato oven and an old petrol pump.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident ceramicist Kirsten Ramsey painstakingly puts the broken bits of a shattered vase by Jean Lurcat, a contemporary of Picasso's, back together again. A precious 19th-century Italian chair and a very special jewellery box are also restored. Narrated by Bill Paterson.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a painting, a ceramic plaque and a Japanese lacquered jewellery box.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Cornwall for more sheds and more rummaging. On Bodmin Moor, James has accumulated his collection over 25 years, which includes everything from motorbikes to amphibious craft. Can the boys score a deal?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: The boys are back in town and travelling to Redruth, where they're confronted with Roy's sheds and their ramshackle contents. There's everything from a model canary-yellow Lamborghini to Harry Potter's Ford Anglia.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes the Chevy to Sweden, where there is a big market for American cars, and hopes to trade his way up to a Volvo Sports Coupe.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.sub-title: If It Ain't Steel, It Ain't Real
programme.desc: Noah's lead fabricator Scott lets loose on a 1962 Chrysler 300. The end result is a completely custom aviation-themed high-performance hot rod.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini hits the jackpot when after finding a 1970 Porsche 911 E Targa with low mileage, he secures a near-mint condition 1962 Jaguar Mark 2 3.8 saloon and an unrestored 1932 Stutz DV32 convertible.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer buys a Datsun 240Z for a seriously good price, but it has an automatic gearbox. Mechanic Edd China restores the iconic car..

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 727 2cam Ferrari owned by the heirs of the Parker Pen is inspected in Maryland, along with a Thunderbird convertible.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer wants to splash the cash on a custom bus, but mechanic Edd China favours a more conservative campervan due to him being an air-cooling expert. the two settle for a VW Split-Screen.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unleash a sleek '67 Jaguar in a New Jersey garage and later pick a general store with a Presidential past.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: The boys continue their Norwegian journey, knowing they need to fill up the van or the trip will make a loss. They head to a Bergen salvage yard, but will they find any useful items in time?.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Brentford v Leeds United and Swansea City v Queens Park Rangers.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents track down a serial killer who has been raping and murdering women in Chicago.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How insects and parasites at a crime scene can offer clues to a victim's time of death and unravel a seemingly concrete alibi.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: A case in which a teenager with an alcohol and drug problem binge-watched American Horror Story and in an act of desperation murdered her grandfather.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 34-year-old Susan Casey. The mother-of-four's body was found floating in the Yellowstone River in May 2008, but the autopsy report concluded that she had been strangled. The investigation went cold for a few years until her ex-husband Walter Larson was arrested.

programme.title: Jodi Arias: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: A re-evaluation of the murder of 30-year-old Travis Alexander in June 2008, a salacious, sensational case defined by sex, obsession, and jealousy gone wrong. Travis's friends soon cast suspicion on his ex-girlfriend, Jodi Arias.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team faces a race against time to rescue Barney, a beagle that wandered into a storm drain and became trapped.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An unusual patient turns up in the form of an albino echidna, and Chris is invited to Symbio Wildlife Park to carry out a highly dangerous procedure on a female Sumatran tiger.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kate finds herself torn between two dresses when she visits the store to pick out something special for her renewal ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride tries on over 100 dresses in the search for the perfect look, while a woman getting married on a beach needs a gown that will cover her bare feet.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride's sister hates every dress she tries on, while another customer is racing against the clock to find a gown - but her own sibling is getting bored of shopping.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa Chimes is under pressure to help a puppy that has been trampled on by its owner, while Dr Chris Brown travels to Adelaide to check on an extremely aggressive Peccary.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Debbie Michaelson discovers newborn puppies hidden in a disused shed, and the SPCA rescues 60 cats from a decaying house.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An investigator tries to rescue an emaciated cat that is trapped in an empty house, while Debbie encounters a pack of feral dogs and a grieving widow's pot-bellied pig.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre, where he saves a set of lathe tools, a sofa and a collection of plant pots in the hope of breathing new life into them.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Plants help provide oxygen and nutrients, but in a criminal investigation, they can also mark the time and location of a person's death.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Brian Williams (aka basketball star Bison Dele) and his girlfriend Serena Karlan, who vanished with their skipper Bertrand Saldo while sailing in the South Pacific in July 2002. Their catamaran was discovered tied up and abandoned at a port in Tahiti. Investigatiors focused their attentions on the only person likely to have information - the missing man's elder brother who had also been on the boat and believed to have moored it.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Michelle McMullen, whose car was found abandoned in September 2008. Pennsylvania investigators set about determining whether she was abducted or on the run, as $2,000 was found to have been stolen from the Susquehanna township church where she worked.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A family bickers and does not listen to what the bride wants. Plus, a mother demands her daughter's custom gown be redesigned.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A demanding dad dominates his daughter's shopping trip, while another father of the bride expects answers when a custom fitting goes wrong.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I've Stalked This Dress on Instagram!
programme.desc: Hayley Paige makes three unique dress in one day, while a bride is determined to have her design a gown for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Am a Bride on a Budget
programme.desc: A struggling actress resolves to pay for her own dress, while a customer falls in love with a dress that is over her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer faces a dilemma, and a bride's friends are not sure what to make of her over-the-top dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride looks for a dress that both she and her grandmother are happy with, while another customer wants to pay tribute to her own late grandmother with her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer tries to reconcile her personal style with her desire to be a very traditional bride, and another woman hopes her grandmother approves of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Won the Battle Against My Twin
programme.desc: A bride tries to get her twin sister's approval of her dress, while another customer needs all four of her siblings to agree with her choice of gown.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock, and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre, where he saves a set of lathe tools, a sofa and a collection of plant pots in the hope of breathing new life into them.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Having spent the last two years in his bed due to his weight, Cillas' food addiction has hampered his relationship with his fiancee and her three daughters.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Chrissie Swan and Anh Do meet 42-year-old Terri King, a terminally ill woman desperate to find her mother Joy, who thought adoption was her daughter's only chance of a decent life. At the time of Terri's birth, Joy was just 16 and homeless, but 18 months later she made the decision to leave her child at the Royal Children's Hospital. Despite years of searching Terri has found no trace of her. Plus, 46-year-old Nicole Engel seeks the nephew she hasn't seen for almost 20 years.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Twenty-eight year-old Kenyan orphan Forence Owitni suffered a growth on his genitals that caused his testicles and penis to swell to the size of bagpipes. Doctors prepare to operate on him.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A student is found dead in a university and a suspect is quickly arrested. However, it is a race against time when another killing suggests the police have held the wrong person.
